summary: This is an email exchange from July 6, 2020, discussing setting up an automatic forwarding rule for court-related email bounces related to Ghislaine Maxwell, following the indictment of Jeffrey Epstein. It appears to be internal communication among legal or administrative staff.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the email discussion about setting up automatic forwarding of court bounces following her indictment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as having been previously indicted, which prompted a similar email forwarding rule.

connections.description: Maxwell is discussed in the context of a similar email forwarding procedure that was set up after Epstein's indictment, implying their legal cases are connected.

events.title: Email exchange about Maxwell court bounce setup
events.description: Internal email discussion about setting up an automatic Outlook rule to forward court-related email bounces for Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

keyFacts: The email exchange occurred on July 6, 2020, discussing administrative procedures for Ghislaine Maxwell's legal case.
A similar automatic email forwarding rule for court bounces had been set up previously after Jeffrey Epstein was indicted.
The communication suggests ongoing legal proceedings and coordination among staff handling Maxwell's case following Epstein's indictment.
